title: Zelensky Urges Barring Russian and Belarusian Athletes from 2024 Olympics
description: In recent days, international Olympic officials have been unclear about whether the athletes will be allowed to compete in the Paris Summer Olympics.

title: Russia Launches a Wave of Iranian-Made Drones at Kyiv After a Lull
description: Analysts had surmised that Russia was having trouble with the drones, but if a problem has been fixed, it remains unclear how long the Kremlin can sustain such attacks.

title: Argentina’s Most Sacred World Cup Watch Party: Maradona’s Former Home
description: A Buenos Aires businessman bought Diego Maradona’s old house and has been opening it up for Argentina’s World Cup matches, meat included.

title: Brussels Court Orders 3 Linked to Qatar Bribery Case to Stay in Prison
description: Belgian officials said they suspected a Gulf country of trying “to influence the economic and political decisions of the European Parliament.”

title: Your Thursday Briefing: China’s Snarled Covid Data
description: Plus France just beat Morocco to advance to the World Cup finals.

title: As Strikes Expand, Britain Faces a New ‘Winter of Discontent’
description: In the 1970s, Margaret Thatcher accused the Labour government of losing control. Now, the same charge is being leveled by Labour against the Conservatives.

title: Zelensky Calls for War Tribunal for Russia’s ‘Crime of Aggression’
description: Ukraine’s president made the remarks as he accepted the union’s top human rights award on behalf of his people.

title: Iran Ousted From UN Women’s Rights Agency in US-backed Vote
description: The resolution was the strongest symbolic gesture so far by the U.N. in response to Iran’s efforts to quell a women-led uprising now in its third month.

title: Peru to Declare National State of Emergency Amid Deadly Protests
description: The measure would suspend some civil rights, including the freedom of assembly, and deepens a crisis set off when the elected president was impeached by Congress last week.

title: The U.S. wants to counter China’s moves in Africa. But American officials try not to mention that.
description: President Biden and his aides do not want the nearly 50 African leaders attending the event to perceive that official U.S. interests on the continent are mainly driven by a desire to counter China.

title: US Wants to Counter China’s Moves in Africa, But Officials Try Not to Mention That
description: President Biden and his aides do not want the nearly 50 African leaders attending the event to perceive that official U.S. interests on the continent are mainly driven by a desire to counter China.

title: Rwanda’s President Says the US Can’t ‘Bully’ Him Into Releasing Rusesabagina
description: President Paul Kagame of Rwanda suggested that only an invasion of his country could force him to release Paul Rusesabagina, a rescuer in the 1994 Rwandan genocide.

title: Istanbul Mayor Jailed for Insulting Public Officials, Barring Him From Politics
description: The mayor of Istanbul, a possible rival to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in the 2023 elections, was convicted of insulting public officials.

title: China Withdraws 6 Diplomats From U.K. After Consulate Scuffle
description: The British government had asked the Chinese officials to waive their diplomatic immunity and allow an investigation into how a pro-democracy protester was beaten.

title: In Liberia and Across Africa, Viktor Bout’s Bloody Legacy Is Still Felt
description: The Russian arms dealer swapped for Brittney Griner was convicted of conspiring to kill Americans. But in the 1990s and early 2000s, he supplied weapons to myriad African conflicts.

title: For the Lost Children of Tuam, a Proper Burial at Last
description: Hundreds of bodies were buried under a playground at a home for unwed mothers, many in a disused sewage system. Almost six years after Ireland acknowledged the grim discovery, a resolution is finally near.

title: New Zealand Bans Cigarette Sales to Everyone Born After 2008
description: The new laws are aimed at eliminating most smoking by 2025 and slashing the number of licensed tobacco retailers.

title: In Fiji’s Closely Observed Election, a Former Coup Leader Is Ahead
description: In a region where China and the United States fight for influence, observers await results from the vote to choose the island nation’s prime minister — and to see if the outcome will be respected.

title: Grant Wahl Died of a Burst Blood Vessel, His Family Says
description: An autopsy in New York showed that the journalist had a tear in the ascending aorta, a large vessel that carries blood from the heart.

title: Russia Targets Kyiv With Drones in Early Morning Attacks
description: Most of the Iranian-made drones were intercepted by Ukrainian air defense systems. Russia has focused attacks on infrastructure for weeks as the harsh winter sets in.

title: Pope Francis Calls for ‘Humble’ Christmas and Urges Donating to Ukraine
description: “Let us not forget Christmas,” the pope said at the end of his weekly general audience, “but with the people of Ukraine in our hearts, and let us offer concrete signs of help for them.”

title: Turning Sci-fi Into Reality
description: Scientists announced a nuclear fusion breakthrough.

title: At Least 135 Die in Congo After Floods Hit Kinshasa
description: In Kinshasa, a megacity of 15 million, heavy rain left roads, infrastructure and many neighborhoods underwater or in ruins.

title: ‘Banksy of Borovsk,’ a Russian Muralist, Wages His Own War
description: An 84-year-old artist, defying Moscow’s crackdown on dissent, wants his country to acknowledge misdeeds both past and present.

title: Migrant Boat Capsizes in English Channel
description: British maritime authorities were carrying out a major rescue operation, a day after the government announced new plans to slow such crossings.

title: Two Dogs, Two Presidents and a History of Political Attacks in Seoul
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un gifted two pups to South Korea as a symbol of peace. Now the canines have become victims of a political squabble between leaders in the South.

title: How Will China Fare With Covid? ‘Meaningless’ Data Clouds the Picture.
description: Despite assurances that the situation is under control, information on infections has become more opaque now that Beijing has rolled back pandemic restrictions.

title: Russia’s ‘Sham’ Charge of Spying Makes Whelan’s Case the Hardest
description: Supporters say Paul Whelan is more hapless tourist than James Bond — and that the Russians know it. But that doesn’t make freeing him any easier.

title: A Powerful Climate Leader From a Small Island Nation
description: Mia Mottley, the prime minister of Barbados, has been drawing attention to the environmental and financial threats faced by small and vulnerable countries like hers.

title: They Fought the Lawn. And the Lawn Lost.
description: After their homeowner association ordered them to replace their wildlife-friendly plants with turf grass, a Maryland couple sued. They ended up changing state law.

title: A New Figure Emerges to Shake Up Georgia’s Status Quo
description: With the country’s politics ‘on hold’ during Russia’s war on Ukraine, Anna Dolidze is awaiting her turn to lead on grass roots issues.

title: Joy and Anxiety Collide as Moroccans Look to World Cup Match With France
description: Morocco’s magical run has elated fans, but for some, the strain of the impending showdown with the country’s former colonial overlords is too much.

title: Countries Pledge $1 Billion in Aid for Ukraine
description: A French-led effort to involve dozens of countries aims to help Ukraine survive a harsh winter with quick repair of vital electrical, heating, water and health care systems.
